response.content:
{
  "step1": "Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 8‑inch round cake pans. In a large bowl whisk together 1½ cups flour, ¾ cup cocoa powder, 2 cups sugar, 1½ tsp baking powder, 1½ tsp baking soda, and 1 tsp salt. Set aside.",
  "step2": "In a separate bowl whisk 2 eggs, 1 cup whole milk, ½ cup vegetable oil, and 2 tsp vanilla extract until smooth. Add 1 cup boiling water, stirring slowly to avoid curdling. Pour the wet mixture into the dry ingredients, mixing until just combined.",
  "step3": "Divide batter evenly between the prepared pans. Tap pans gently on the counter to release air bubbles. Bake for 25–30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let cakes cool in pans for 10 minutes, then transfer to wire racks to cool completely.",
  "step4": "While cakes cool, prepare frosting: beat ½ cup softened butter until creamy. Gradually add 3 cups powdered sugar, ¼ cup cocoa powder, 2 tbsp milk, and 1 tsp vanilla. Beat until light and fluffy, adding more milk if needed for spreadable consistency.",
  "step5": "Place one cake layer on a serving plate. Spread a generous layer of frosting over the top. Place the second layer on top, then apply a thin crumb coat around the entire cake. Chill for 15 minutes to set the crumb coat before applying the final frosting layer.",
  "step6": "Finish by piping decorative swirls or chocolate shavings on the top. Slice and serve. Enjoy your rich, moist chocolate cake, perfect for 8 guests!"
}
